neighborhoods.name: Centro Storico & Porto Antico
neighborhoods.character: The historic heart of Genoa containing the highest concentration of medieval and Renaissance architecture, maritime heritage, and cultural institutions.

location.description: The central district of Genoa encompassing the historic center and the transformed Old Port area.

history.overview: Centro Storico represents the ancient core of Genoa with over 2,000 years of history, including its golden age as a powerful maritime republic.
history.significance: This district contains the highest concentration of medieval and Renaissance architecture in Liguria, serving as the center of Mediterranean trade during the 12th-18th centuries.
notable_events: Rule of the Doria family (13th-18th centuries)
Transformation of Porto Antico for Expo '92

practical_info.safety: Generally safe but watch for pickpockets in crowded tourist areas.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Early morning or evening to avoid crowds, especially in high season.
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable with primarily pedestrian-only zones.

attractions.name: Genoa Cathedral (San Lorenzo)
attractions.description: Iconic cathedral with distinctive black and white striped façade and treasury containing the Sacro Catino.
attractions.appeal: Marvel at medieval architecture and see one of Italy's most important religious treasures.

attractions.name: Aquarium of Genoa
attractions.description: Italy's largest aquarium housing over 12,000 marine animals in 70 tanks.
attractions.appeal: Experience marine life from around the world in one spectacular facility.

attractions.name: Palazzo Ducale
attractions.description: Historic palace that served as Genoa's government seat for over 600 years.
attractions.appeal: Explore grand halls and learn about Genoa's maritime republic history.

dining.name: Antica Focacceria Sottoripa
dining.known_for: Traditional focaccia and Ligurian street food
dining.atmosphere: Historic focacceria with authentic local atmosphere.

dining.name: Ristorante Zeffirino
dining.known_for: Pesto alla genovese and seafood specialties

activities.name: Maritime History Walking Tour
activities.description: Guided exploration of Genoa's maritime heritage and historic architecture.

activities.name: Palazzo Ducale Secret Passages Tour
activities.description: Behind-the-scenes exploration of hidden corridors in Genoa's medieval palace.

stay_here_if: You want to be within walking distance of major attractions.
You're a first-time visitor to Genoa.
You don't mind tourist crowds and higher prices.
avoid_if: You're sensitive to crowds and noise.
You prefer more authentic local experiences.
insider_tips: Visit major sites at opening time to avoid tour groups.
Book aquarium tickets online at least a week in advance.
Try aperitivo at cafes in lesser-known piazzas rather than the main squares.

neighborhoods.name: Via Garibaldi (Strade Nuove)
neighborhoods.character: Elegant, aristocratic neighborhood featuring some of Genoa's most magnificent Renaissance and Baroque palaces, now housing museums and cultural institutions.

location.description: Located in the heart of the historic center, featuring the prestigious Strade Nuove (New Streets) built for Genoa's noble families.

history.overview: Developed between the 16th and 18th centuries to showcase the wealth and power of Genoa's noble families.
history.significance: UNESCO World Heritage site representing the height of Genoa's architectural and cultural achievement during the maritime republic's golden age.
notable_events: Transformation of palaces into public museums

transit: Walking distance to all major attractions
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for architecture appreciation, afternoon for museum visits.
practical_info.walkability: Very walkable with elegant, wide streets.

attractions.name: Palazzo Rosso
attractions.description: Magnificent palace housing important art collections including works by Van Dyck and Caravaggio.
attractions.appeal: Experience aristocratic living and view masterpieces in an authentic palace setting.

attractions.name: Palazzo Bianco
attractions.description: Elegant palace featuring paintings from the 13th to 18th centuries.
attractions.appeal: Explore Genoese and European art in a beautiful historic setting.

attractions.name: Palazzo Doria-Tursi
attractions.description: Grand palace housing the city hall and important civic collections.
attractions.appeal: Visit Genoa's town hall and see the famous Paganini violin.

dining.name: Osteria di Vico Palla
dining.known_for: Authentic minestrone and rabbit Ligurian style

dining.name: Caffè degli Specchi
dining.atmosphere: Historic café with Belle Époque interiors.

activities.name: Palace Museum Tour
activities.description: Visit the three main palaces to understand Genoa's artistic and cultural heritage.

activities.name: Architectural Photography
activities.description: Capture the elegant façades and architectural details of the Renaissance palaces.

stay_here_if: You want to be in the heart of Genoa's cultural district.
You appreciate elegant architecture and refined atmosphere.
You want easy access to major museums and attractions.
avoid_if: You prefer more authentic, local neighborhoods.
insider_tips: Purchase a combined ticket for all three palaces to save money and time.
Visit early morning for the best light for photography.
The palaces are less crowded than other major Genoa attractions.

neighborhoods.name: Boccadasse
neighborhoods.character: Charming, picturesque fishing village that has been absorbed into Genoa, known for colorful cliffside houses, seafood restaurants, and authentic Ligurian atmosphere.

location.description: Located along the eastern coast of Genoa, about 3km from the city center.

history.overview: Originally an independent fishing village that maintained its distinctive character even after incorporation into Genoa.
history.significance: Preserves the authentic maritime culture and traditional Ligurian lifestyle that once characterized all of coastal Genoa.
notable_events: Preservation of traditional character despite urban expansion

transit: Pleasant coastal walk from Porto Antico
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Late afternoon through sunset for the best atmosphere and dining.
practical_info.walkability: Walkable but involves some hills and narrow streets.

attractions.name: Boccadasse Beach
attractions.description: Small pebble beach perfect for swimming and enjoying the Mediterranean.
attractions.appeal: Experience authentic Ligurian beach culture away from tourist crowds.

attractions.name: Colorful Houses
attractions.description: Historic houses built into the cliffs in traditional Ligurian style.
attractions.appeal: Capture postcard-perfect photos of authentic Italian coastal architecture.

attractions.name: Fishing Harbor
attractions.description: Active fishing harbor with traditional boats and maritime atmosphere.
attractions.appeal: Observe traditional fishing culture and local maritime life.

dining.name: Ristorante Il Marin
dining.atmosphere: Sophisticated dining with panoramic Mediterranean views.

dining.name: Il Marin
dining.known_for: Pesto alla genovese and sea bass in salt crust
dining.atmosphere: Lively tavern with maritime decor and communal tables.

dining.name: Focacceria di Boccadasse
dining.atmosphere: Perfect for beachside snacks while exploring.

activities.name: Sunset Photography
activities.description: Capture the colorful houses and fishing boats bathed in golden light.

activities.name: Seafood Dining
activities.description: Experience authentic Ligurian seafood cuisine in traditional settings.

stay_here_if: You want a peaceful, authentic coastal atmosphere.
You don't mind being slightly removed from the city center.
You prefer maritime culture and seafood dining.
avoid_if: You want to be in the center of the action.
You have mobility issues (area involves hills).
You want extensive shopping and nightlife options.
insider_tips: Walk along the coastal path from Porto Antico for beautiful sea views.
Visit in the evening for the best dining atmosphere and sunset views.
Try the local focaccia varieties for authentic Ligurian street food.

neighborhoods.name: Nervi
neighborhoods.character: Elegant, residential neighborhood known for its beautiful parks, gardens, and sophisticated atmosphere, popular with locals and visitors seeking tranquility.

location.description: Located in eastern Genoa, about 5km from the city center, along the coast.

history.overview: Developed as a resort area in the 19th century, known for its beautiful gardens and elegant villas.
history.significance: Home to some of Genoa's most beautiful gardens and a popular destination for relaxation and nature appreciation.
notable_events: Creation of Villa Durazzo Pallavicini Gardens

transit: Train station with connections to Genoa
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for gardens, afternoon for coastal walks.
practical_info.walkability: Very walkable with beautiful coastal paths.

attractions.name: Villa Durazzo Pallavicini Gardens
attractions.description: Magnificent 19th-century gardens with romantic landscape design and exotic plants.
attractions.appeal: Escape the city in one of Genoa's most beautiful and peaceful green spaces.

attractions.name: Nervi Park
attractions.description: Extensive public park with walking paths, playgrounds, and coastal views.
attractions.appeal: Enjoy free access to beautiful natural surroundings and family-friendly activities.

attractions.name: Coastal Promenade
attractions.description: Beautiful coastal walkway connecting Nervi to other coastal areas.
attractions.appeal: Experience stunning Mediterranean views while enjoying peaceful exercise.

dining.name: Ristorante Da Gaia
dining.known_for: Pesto with green beans and seasonal sea bass
dining.atmosphere: Refined dining with open kitchen and organic focus.

dining.name: Trattoria da Ugo
dining.atmosphere: Cozy and bright with focus on traditional Ligurian dishes.

dining.name: Caffè del Porto
dining.atmosphere: Trendy concept space with harbor views.

activities.name: Garden Exploration
activities.description: Visit the beautiful gardens and parks for peaceful relaxation.

activities.name: Coastal Walking
activities.description: Enjoy the beautiful coastal promenade with Mediterranean views.

stay_here_if: You want a peaceful, nature-filled environment.
You don't mind being removed from the city center.
You appreciate beautiful gardens and coastal scenery.
avoid_if: You want to be in the center of the action.
You need extensive shopping and nightlife options.
insider_tips: Visit the gardens early morning for the best light and fewer crowds.
Combine a visit to Nervi with Boccadasse for a coastal day trip.
The coastal promenade is perfect for sunset walks.

neighborhoods.name: San Lorenzo & Mercato Orientale
neighborhoods.character: Bustling, market-focused district with authentic Genoese atmosphere, traditional food shops, and historic churches.

location.description: Located in the historic center, containing the main food market and important religious sites.

history.overview: The historic market district of Genoa with traditions dating back centuries.
history.significance: Economic and cultural center of Genoa with the city's main food market tradition.
notable_events: Construction of San Lorenzo basilica (12th-14th centuries)

transit: Walking distance to all major attractions
practical_info.safety: Generally safe but watch for pickpockets around the market area.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for market shopping, afternoon for cultural sites.

attractions.name: Mercato Orientale
attractions.description: Historic covered market with traditional vendors selling fresh produce, meats, and Ligurian specialties.
attractions.appeal: Experience authentic Genoese food culture and shop like a local.

attractions.name: Basilica di San Lorenzo
attractions.description: Historic church with important religious artifacts and beautiful architecture.
attractions.appeal: Visit one of Genoa's most important religious sites with fewer crowds.

attractions.name: Traditional Food Shops
attractions.description: Authentic shops selling Ligurian specialties like pesto, farinata, and local wines.
attractions.appeal: Purchase authentic local products and souvenirs directly from artisans.

dining.name: Panificio Patrone
dining.atmosphere: Authentic bakery with traditional Ligurian breads.

dining.name: Mercato Orientale Food Stalls
dining.known_for: Variety of high-quality Ligurian and Italian options
dining.atmosphere: Bustling market atmosphere with local specialties.

activities.name: Market Shopping and Tasting
activities.description: Explore the traditional market and surrounding food shops.

activities.name: Food Culture Tour
activities.description: Learn about Genoa's food traditions and sample local specialties.

stay_here_if: You want authentic Genoese atmosphere with great food options.
Shopping and food are priorities for your visit.
You want to be close to major attractions.
insider_tips: The market closes early afternoon, so visit in the morning for the best selection.
Try the local focaccia varieties for authentic Ligurian street food.
Many traditional shops close on Sundays.
